entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_100_DESCRIPTION: Another world thought to have inspired the unique arts developed in Grand Gaia. Without humans, only machines seem to inhabit this place.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_101_DESCRIPTION: A frozen world ruled by a mystical wolf and sealed under snow and ice, but still inhabited by the humans that once migrated from Grand Gaia.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_102_DESCRIPTION: A world known as "Ohbanahara" that is culturally distinct from Elgaia, but is also home to the samurai and shinobi of Grand Gaian legends.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_11_DESCRIPTION: The first region of Ishgria, accessible via the Grand Gaia Crater. According to the Summoner who ventured there, it is an overwhelming sight.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_12_DESCRIPTION: The region past Celgrad, which connects Grand Gaia to Ishgria. It is just as peculiar looking and dangerous as its neighboring land as well.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_13_DESCRIPTION: The northeastern island of Ishgria. Compared to other areas, it is home to many more ruins. Otherworldly techniques can also be seen here and there.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_14_DESCRIPTION: A region to the east of Ishgria which grows a miasma-emitting flower of gigantic size. Many structures have been spotted there, perhaps ruins?
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_15_DESCRIPTION: The area north of Wulgee. Housing a facility which studies otherworldly techniques, this place stands out as suspicious even amidst its surroundings.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_16_DESCRIPTION: The region northwest of Ishgria, distinguished by the giant shadow cast on its cliffs. Unlike other regions, it does not have many ruins.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_17_DESCRIPTION: A region located in western Ishgria said to be ruled by a demon with the power of dragons. Legends of ancient dragons have been found here.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_18_DESCRIPTION: A frigid region, once home to the oldest nation in Ishgria. Records say that it thrived as the heart of the demon nation in ancient times.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_19_DESCRIPTION: The land where the Holy Emperor Karna Masta, thought to have fallen in Ishgria, is sealed. This land bears fresh scars of his wrath.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_1_DESCRIPTION: The first land you arrive at passing through Lucius’ Gate. Ruled over by Maxwell, mighty God of Creation and one of the Four Fallen Gods.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_20_DESCRIPTION: Home of the king who once sought to conquer Ishgria. Invaders are held off by the knowledge that Karna Masta's true power is sealed here.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_2_DESCRIPTION: A region newly discovered by the Akras Summoners’ Hall. Rumored to be teeming with dangerous monsters, much of its territory is yet to be explored.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_3_DESCRIPTION: The land which opened up upon Maxwell's defeat. This area consists mainly of the islands of Amdahl, Encervis, and Palmyna.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_4_DESCRIPTION: In the area once home to the La Veda Republic, reports suggest that relics considered sacred by former followers of the God of Light still remain.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_5_DESCRIPTION: Scars of war dot the ruins of what was once the capital of the prosperous Agni Empire. This land is now under the control of the Four Fallen Gods.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_6_DESCRIPTION: The alliance of various countries formed the Principality of Vriksha. This verdant land is controlled by the last of the Four Fallen Gods, Afla Dilith.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_7_DESCRIPTION: Many of Atharva Republic's ruins sleep here. The electric Mt. Granakia lies at its center, where the legendary hero Eze is said to have trained.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_8_DESCRIPTION: Many countries existed at the heart of the Bariura Empire. However, the rage of an ancient dragon and the war with the gods brought upon their ruin.
entries.MST_DUNGEONS_CONTINENT_999_DESCRIPTION: Another world thought to have inspired the unique arts developed in Grand Gaia. A land without humans, only machines seem to inhabit it now.
